fields.description:
Hello,

I already posted a message about this issue on the forum the last week but I got no answer.

I have a team account that contains 3 groups: one for admin permissions, one for read/write permissions and one for read permissions. However, the permissions for these groups and the users associated to these groups are not automatically propagated to all the repositories that are owned by the team account (although the checkbox that says "Group name have write access to this account's repositories" is ticked).

To make it works, I have to go to the administration of each team repository; then access management and finally to add the team groups by specifying again the permission type (read/write/admin) whereas the team groups already have these information.

Is it a bug? If not, the sentence "have read/write/admin access to this account's repositories" is really embarrassing. Is there a page that explains group and team permissions in details?

Also, I have some team members that complain to receive emails each time I perform some tests with groups and permissions. Could you add a checkbox or something to disable notifications from the team administration?

One more question about permissions, if I give admin permission to a user through a team group does it also gives write access to team repositories?
fields.summary: Team permissions not applied to team repositories

fields.description:
When adding some users at new groups, they havent been listed as team members.

Only when added to default "Developers" or "Administrators" groups they are listed as team members.

This is probably related to group ids and the relationship with the team list was not built properly.
fields.summary: Members added to groups arent listed as team members (BB-4535)

fields.description:
When opening the repository 'access management' tab in Internet Explorer 8, the user list is not loaded. The message "Loading..." is displayed, but nothing happens. It is also not possible to add users with read, write or admin access. When entering the user name manually, BitBucket shows an error message "No user named ...", although a user with this name definitely exists. This also happens when selecting a ame from the search-as-you-type list that appears when manually entering a user name.

Everything works fine in Safari (Mobile), so I guess it is a browser issue.
fields.summary: Repository Access Management not working in IE8

fields.description:
Hi @all,

I had my company email address (mhubig@imko.de) assigned to our company account http://bitbucket.org/imko. But now I changed the email address of our company account to admin@imko.de and reassigned my company address to my account http://bitbucket.org/mhubig. But now I can't confirm this address. If I click on the link in the confirmation email I get the error: "We were unable to confirm the email address. The validation email may have expired".
fields.summary: Error after atempt to transfer email addess to another account

fields.description:
{{{\\
git clone git@bitbucket.org:gafar/dictionaries.git\\
Cloning into dictionaries...\\
Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
}}}

But this repository is public. How can I fix this?
fields.summary: get "Permission denied (publickey)." for public repositories

fields.description:
I have created a wiki page with «New» button, called "Утилита «Гравер»". I've put a link into the Homepage of wiki:

{{{[[Утилита «Гравер»]]}}}

and saved the page. Now, when I click on this link, I get 404-error page. If I press «New» button and try to enter the same name, I get the previous wiki-code of previously created page. It seems that the page exists, but the linkage machanism doesn't work well.

For those who understands Russian:

----
Создаю новую страницу в Wiki, делаю на неё ссылку с Home, тыкаю в ссылку — получаю 404 ошибку. При этом, похоже, что сама ранее созданная страница существует, поскольку при повторной попытке создать страницу с тем же именем мне выдаётся ранее сохранённый код.

Что я делаю не так?
fields.summary: Link from Wiki leads to 404-page, but the corresponding page exists

fields.description:
Correct me if I'm wrong. When creating a patch queue the original code repo is cloned (and mq is initialized in it) so the user is able to pull changes from it. I assume the wiki isn't (it's probably created from scratch) because I'm getting "repository is unrelated" message when trying to pull updates from the original wiki repo and the initial changeset ids are different (in contrary to code repos).

It would be nice to be able to use the same workflow when working with the wiki repo (work on the documentation using patches).
fields.summary: Creating a patch queue doesn't clone the wiki repository. (BB-4536)

fields.description:
Correct me if I'm wrong. When creating a patch queue the original code repo is cloned (and mq is initialized in it) so the user is able to pull changes from it. I assume the wiki isn't (it's probably created from scratch) because I'm getting "repository is unrelated" message when trying to pull updates from the original wiki repo and the initial changeset ids are different (in contrary to code repos).

It would be nice to be able to use the same workflow when working with the wiki repo (work on the documentation using patches).

fields.description:
* It looks like adding BitBucket repository link does not accept every valid URL as value of the "link_url" parameter.
* In particular, if the URL address is in the following form: "http://MartinSkurla-PC:2990/jira" it is not accepted by BitBucket REST API for adding repository link.

fields.description:
The last two pull requests I've accepted in my mbrekkevold/nav-mirror repository have generated e-mail notices where two different, unrelated usernames are listed as having accepted the pull requests:

"Pull request #X has been accepted by <random unrelated user>"

fields.description:
Bitbucket could track when people pull from a repository and use this information to make it safer to strip changesets.

That is, if I push to a public repository on Bitbucket and then go to the strip admin page, then it would be great if I could be told "nobody has pulled the changeset" or maybe "user foo and bar have already pulled, are you sure you want to strip?".
fields.summary: Track if a changeset has been pulled, use this to make strip safe (BB-4529)

fields.description:
Created by danielhschreiber@gmail.com

this creation is showing up in various in boxes. Please mark as spam.
fields.summary: Email spoofing is fun

fields.description: Title is self-explanatory.  The Issues service is one of the simplest, easiest and most useful services that Bitbucket has, I can't think of any reason that this shouldn't be enabled by default...
fields.summary: Issues services should be enabled by default.

fields.description:
== Description ==

When you upload a repository download (on the repository -> downloads section or "r d" on bitbucket.org web site) to a repository having the "." character on its name, you cannot download the file. The cdn.bitbucket.org site hosting the actual downloadable file returns a forbidden http response when accessing the file.

== Steps to reproduce ==

h1. Go to the bitbucket.org website.
h1. Create a git repository having a "." character in its name, such as "whatever.testing".
h1. Go to the repository downloads sections.
h1. Upload any file to the downloads. The new download will be created and available on the downloads list.
h1. Click on the download link. You will see a "forbidden" error page.
== Remarks ==

Bitbucket does not have any kind of repository namespacing built in, so i bet many users implement their own namespacing schemas in the repository name. The "." character is very often used as a nest indicator, for example, in "carbon.concerto" or "carbon.accounts".
fields.summary: Downloads not working on repositories with "." in their name

fields.description: When I create new issue with title in Russian its url is not transliterated and replaced by lines (--------------------)
fields.summary: The correct transliteration of other languages (BB-4525)

fields.description: Some SourceForge projects, e.g., Jikes RVM [http://sourceforge.net/projects/jikesrvm/], have multiple Mercurial repositories. Currently, you cannot import these individually using the "Import Repository" UI, as you are only allowed to enter the project name (jikesrvm), but not the specific repository you want (e.g., jikesrvm or soc2011): [http://jikesrvm.hg.sourceforge.net/hgweb/jikesrvm/].
fields.summary: SourceForge import should allow for multi-repository projects (BB-4524)

Thank you,\\
enomoto

Whenever someone accepts a Pull Request on any of our repositories /Torpedo7/ we get 2 emails.\\
One from the person accepting the request, and one from a random user also accepting the request.\\
I have attached a few of the incorrect notification emails.

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to show

* issues from *my* repositories
* issues from repositories *I'm following*
* all *my* issues
* issues *that are assigned to me*

This can be the end for randomly "drowned" issues. What do you think?
fields.summary: Ability to show issues across repositories (BB-4505)

fields.description: Internet Explorer (10.0.8400.0 Release Preview) renders that "create pull request" button in the upper right-hand side of the page repeating the blue rightward arrow in the background of the button, independently from the foreground which does still contain the right text, and also the blue arrow. The text "create pull request" is barely readable, though.
fields.summary: Web browser issues (#3 - Internet Explorer - Button looking weird) (BB-4503)

fields.description:
I know this one might not quite be an issue of yours, but I can see source code line numbers go "out of sync" with the actual code when I scroll down a source file of more than a 100 lines of code. Internet Explorer 10.0.8400.0 Release Preview and Opera 12.0 display stuff correctly, so my guess is that this is an issue of Mozilla's.\\
Firefox 13.0.1 once again.
fields.summary: Web browser issues (#2 - Firefox - Line number heights appear wrong) (BB-4504)

fields.description: I've noticed that browsing my source code (git repos) in Firefox or Opera, I need to refresh the site to view the modified dates and the commit messages. Won't load them in the first place. The only browser I've proven to do it well is Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Web browser issues (#1 - Firefox & Opera - Messages not updating) (BB-4530)

fields.description: It's currently impossible to activate wiki/issues for a repository created without them using the API. If I include has_wiki = true during the creation, the repository will be created with wiki, but doing a PUT with has_wiki = true has no effect. I can change other fields like no_public_forks, so it seems to be a bug.
fields.summary: REST API: unable to change has_wiki/has_issues via a PUT request (BB-4506)

fields.description: There's currently no way to create or manage username aliases using the REST API. It would be nice if I could at least specify the aliases when creating the repo.
fields.summary: REST API: username alias management (BB-4507)

fields.description:
When viewing the issue tracker of one of my projects, I am often interested in seeing the highest priority issues.  To do this, I go to the issue tracker and click on the exclamation mark (!) at the top of the third column.  This sorts by priority with the *lowest* priority first and I have to click again to get highest priority first.

I can't imagine that many users are interested in seeing their lowest priority bugs first when sorting by priority.  I believe it would be more intuitive for the *first* priority ordering offered to be highest-priority first.  If users really want to see the lowest priority at the top of the list they can click again to swap the sort order.
fields.summary: Sorting issues by priority is unintuitive (BB-4502)
No support for ECDSA keys (BB-12110)

fields.description: When I created a new repo I made it private, expecting that only I would have access to it. Apparently that's not the case though, since the defaults also gave write access to one of my user groups (I only have one, so maybe all user groups). This should be either changed or clarified, I think. In the settings for issue tracker/wiki it says "visible only to people who are explicitly granted access".
fields.summary: New private repo isn't private

fields.description: Images (and other non-.wiki content) are not accessible in private wikis via custom domains (CNAME). To reproduce push an image and view in a browser using your domain name. When the wiki is private the server returns a 403 forbidden response for images. Changing the wiki to public or accessing the page via bitbucket.org will cause the image to be displayed.
fields.summary: 403 error for images in private wikis (BB-4537)

fields.description:
Attached file is a result of\\
curl --user 'kbrazulewicz:XXXXXXXXXXXX' https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/bamboo/branches/?format=xml

The reason is a bizarre branch name "BSP-6780 - support for mercurial subrepos with relative path" which shouldn't be used as an XML tag name.
fields.summary: REST API can return unparseable XML output (BB-4508)

fields.description:
Hi,

When doing:

ssh -C hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R my_user_name/sillyrepos"

I get the response:

conq: invalid repository syntax.

The original command was:

hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/my_user_name/sillyrepos\\
which echos\\
running ssh -C hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R my_use_name/sillyrepos serve --stdio"

Then I tried running the command directly,   ssh -C hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R my_use_name/sillyrepos serve --stdio"

and get this error. "conq: invalid repository syntax."

Any idea what "conq: invalid repository syntax." means or how to debug this.  googling this phrase did not turn too much up.

Thanks in advance for any help or suggesting.
fields.summary: conq: invalid repository syntax.

fields.description:
=== Steps to reproduce (on my wiki anyway) ===

h1. On a wiki page make a link {{{[[Next Page]]}}}
h1. Click on the green plus icon + "New" button to create a new page
h1. Type the exact same string : {{{Next Page}}}
h1. When you then try to follow the link from the original page it takes you to {{{Next_Page}}} and gives you a 404 error since the create page's URL used a space instead of an underscore
h1. Now create page again with the name {{{Next_Page}}}
h1. This link now works (linking to the second created page)
=== Expected behavior ===

Both the contents of a wiki link and what is entered in the "Create a new page" UI should be considered the "name of the page".  Neither should be considered the URL (one of the jobs of a wiki is to keep the user from dealing with site implementation details, one of which is the mapping from page names to their URLs)

==== Additional Note ====\\
I would expect that if the user clicks on a link to a page and that page doesn't exist yet, that they would be taken to the "create page" for that page name (which wouldn't actually create the page until they click "save") instead of being taken to a 404 page.
fields.summary: Wiki internal link with spaces not consistent with adding a page with the same formatting

fields.description:
Hi,

When i tried to import a GIT repository from one of my own server (using GitBlit). There was an error during import :

}}}

The reason was a space at the end of the repository URL.

I think that you can just trim the posted value.\\
Not a Big issue but quite embarrassing.

I really like BitBucket !!!

Thanks,\\
Regards

Rémi
fields.summary: Trim URL repository during import (BB-4523)

fields.description:
When attaching a non-image file to an issue, the issue page attempts to display it as an image, which results in the broken-image icon.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Broken images in issue attachments when attachment is non-image

fields.description: I am in the admin group as part of my team's shared account.  Usually only subset of us are responsible for each of the many repo's on the shared account.  Currently, however, every single person in the group gets an email notification about issue tracker activities across every repo.  This happens regardless of what email addresses we put or don't put in an individual repo's Admin > Issue tracker settings > Notifications.

fields.description:
Currently I have many email addresses configured in my account but I don't want to receive notifications on all of them. But I don't want to remove these address either, because that allows commits to be associated with my account for different repositories in which I use different names.

I wish I could select which addresses I want to use to receive notifications.
fields.summary: Select email addresses for notifications (BB-4522)

fields.description:
The programming code in my README.md is not displayed properly. I've took two screenshots (attached). The first screenshot is from Bitbucket. The second one from a HTML file that I created (how it should look like). For completeness, I'm also attaching the README.md file.

Then there is also an issue with the indentation in lists. When I have several paragraphs, Bitbucket doesn't recognize it as being part of the list and indents it all the way to the left. I've also attached two screenshots.

fields.description:

{{{\\
#!python\\
** Please report this bug to http://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/stable/issues\\
** Mercurial version (1.7.3).  TortoiseHg version (1.1.8)\\
** Command: --nofork log\\
** CWD: C:\Users\Public\Games\CTGW\Data\\
** Extensions loaded: fixfrozenexts\\
** Python 2.6.4 (r264:75708, Oct 26 2009, 08:23:19) [MSC v.1500 32 bit (Intel)]\\
** sys.getwindowsversion(): (6, 1, 7601, 2, 'Service Pack 1')\\
** Processor architecture: x64\\
Recoverable runtime error (stderr):\\
Traceback (most recent call last):\\
File "tortoisehg\hgtk\history.pyo", line 2894, in tree_button_press\\
File "tortoisehg\hgtk\logview\treeview.pyo", line 312, in get_revid_at_path\\
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable

}}}
fields.summary: TortoiseHg Bug Report

fields.description:
A team member should have a way of viewing the team's Newsfeed in the web UI.

Right now, the only way I can see the team account's newsfeed is to log out as myself and log in under the team account.

I can, of course, grab the RSS URL of the team account's Newsfeed and stick that in an RSS reader, and that is my workaround for now. I can also go and follow every repository in the team account, but that just undermines the readability of my own Newsfeed.

When I browse to the team account as a team member, there should be some page that displays the team's Newsfeed.

Or, even better, on my own dashboard page, there perhaps could be a toggle for switching between my Newsfeed, and the Newsfeeds of the team accounts of which I am a member.
fields.summary: View team account's Newsfeed as team member (BB-10029)

fields.description:
I noticed that there is no rel="nofollow" on various links around Bitbucket:

* The redirect link you can setup when you delete a repository: https://bitbucket.org/mg/redirect-test/
* The website link for a repository: https://bitbucket.org/aragost/kick-start
* Links in issues: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3927/#comment-1471649

Have I missed some top-level nofollow directive?
fields.summary: Missing rel="nofollow" on links (BB-4521)

fields.description: Hi.  I've been working on this repository  https://bitbucket.org/gws923/mapmaker and the commits I've made in the last few days are not showing up.  I didn't change anything about how I was committing, no new branches or anything, as far as I can remember.  Any tips?
fields.summary: Commits not showing up

fields.description:
When deleting a repository, you can setup a redirect. This just results in a link being shown when the old repository is visited in a browser.

It would be nice if a real HTTP redirect was issued when a Mercurial client tries to access the old URL. For SSH there's no support for sending redirect information back to the client, but I guess you could maintain a symlink or similar on your server so that old SSH URLs remain valid.
fields.summary: Adding a redirect should make Bitbucket redirect HTTP/SSH automatically (BB-4496)

fields.description:
Great that we can transfer repositories between accounts now!

It would be even greater if a redirect was created when you do so, similarly to how you can (optionally) add a redirect when deleting a repository.
fields.summary: Add redirect when transferring repository ownership (BB-4495)

fields.description:
The link entitled 'closed issues' on the Issues dropdown on a project links to:

https://bitbucket.org/(username)/(project)/issues?status=duplicate&status=invalid&status=resolved&%20status=wontfix

Note the space before the final 'status'.  This means that wontfix issues are excluded, because "%20status" is not a recognised keyword.
fields.summary: Broken 'Closed Issues' link (BB-4494)

fields.description:
Tiny issue, but in using the Bitbucket importer for about 100 repositories, I've noticed that my account Gravatars only successfully load approximately half the time. The rest of the time, they are shown as blank white squares.

See attached screenshot for example.

Behavior observed in Chrome and Chromium on Mac OS X and Linux, have not yet attempted to look in other browsers or on Windows.
fields.summary: Gravatar often fails to load on Import Repository page
When forking a repo, the "Language" does not get set as it is on the original repo (BB-4497)

fields.description:
It would be nice if Bitbucket Cards were to start getting some integration into the main site.

For example, it would be great if there were a Cards tab on a repo's page, sitting right next to the Issues tab, which opens up the Bitbucket Cards page for that repository.
fields.summary: Integrate Bitbucket Cards into main site UI (BB-4486)

fields.description:
My team would love the ability to write and load our own brokers, making them specific to our team account.

For example, we're moving to Bitbucket from Gitolite, where we had our own HipChat notification, which we like better than the existing HipChat broker. We would love the ability to port this script to a Bitbucket broker, and add it to our account and repos.

We're happy to contribute brokers for the rest of Bitbucket to use, of course, but since it's doubtful Bitbucket would start offering multiple brokers for services like HipChat, it seems unlikely that the status quo will be able to meet our desires.

More importantly, however, we have some use cases where we would love the ability to write a broker that isn't intended for public use (one that communicates with a custom internal tool of ours, for example). The ability to write and load custom brokers specific to our account would go a long way to solving the needs of these use cases.
fields.summary: Custom, account-specific brokers (BB-4490)

fields.description:
This is a minor thing, but I just got a notification email from a pull request I accepted, but the 'From' line and the body of the notification both say it's from 'zenvoautomotive' ("Pull request BCLOUD-9 has been accepted by zenvoautomotive"). I have no idea who zenvoautomotive is, but it gave me a momentary start to see that they had accepted a pull request on my behalf. :P

Anyway, it's probably just cosmetic, but I thought you might want to know.

I've attached the raw email source in case the headers might help track something down.
fields.summary: Pull request email has wrong sender name

fields.description:
It should be possible to define services at the account level (particularly now with team accounts), and have those service settings propagate to all repositories on that account.

For example, my team uses HipChat and we obviously want all of our repos to use the HipChat notification. Right now, that involves a painful one-at-a-time manual process of adding the service to every repo, and remembering to do it again when we add new repos.

Just as we are able to define user groups so that we don't have to do this manual process for each repository's read/write/admin access, we should be able to define default services so that we don't have to do this for each repo's services.
fields.summary: Default services for all repos in account (BB-4489)

fields.description: In IE8, the group and access administration screens for repos and groups do not load.
fields.summary: IE8: Administrating groups doesn't work (BB-4477)

fields.description:
Wrong sample.

$ cd /path/to/my/repo

$ git remote add origin https://umitunal@bitbucket.org/umitunal/spring-mvc-test.git

$ git push -u origin *master*   # to push changes for the first time

Correct sample

$ cd /path/to/my/repo

$ git remote add *master* https://umitunal@bitbucket.org/umitunal/spring-mvc-test.git

$ git push -u origin master   # to push changes for the first time
fields.summary: I have code I want to import information

fields.description:
It looks like you guys are using https://github.com/harvesthq/chosen for the select boxes on the pull request page. The most recent version has support for hitting tab to select the top option and proceed to the next item, but the version on bitbucket doesn't behave this way - tabbing leaves the selected item unchanged.

ie if 'master' is selected, typing 'bu' will display 'bug_fixes' as the top option, and hitting enter will lock it in, whereas hitting tab will leave 'master' as the selected item, the latest version of chosen will lock 'bug_fixes' in as the selected version when tabbing (see the single selects at http://harvesthq.github.com/chosen/ for live examples)
fields.summary: Upgrade to a more recent version of Chosen (BB-4488)

fields.description:
push code to bitbucket is very very slow in china, and get a error at last.

the errorr is :

URLError: [Errno 10053] An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine

https://skitch.com/kburke/eyr79/notification-markdowncss-kburkeorg-gmail.com-gmail

There's no real link from there to a place where I can handle the notification - the only link is to a place where I can stop receiving notifications.
fields.summary: Link from notification email to place where I can deal with the notification

fields.description:
When I put \usepackage{pdfcomment.sty} in my preamble, it immediately changes the date format used by the \today macro. My normal date format rendered by \today is 'June 11, 2012'. As soon as I put \usepackage{pdfcomment.sty} in the pramble, it changes the output of \today, everywhere in my document to 'Monday 11th June 2012'  Any help removing this interference would be greatly appreciated.\\
Thanks\\
ed.lewis at enlewis dot com
fields.summary: pdfcomment.sty interferes with date format

fields.description:
When a user transfers a repository, offer to redirect to the new location.

The catch would be that there must be a way to remove the redirect should the user decide to fork that repo or create one with the same name in the future.
fields.summary: Offer a redirect for transferred repositories (BB-4474)

fields.description:
It is not possible to link a page if the target page has a title containing spaces and it is not possible to delete the new page as well.

When creating a new page, the new page is visible in the list of pages just after creation but not anymore if you get into the wiki.
fields.summary: Wiki Page creation with space in the title
ssh issue after repositosy name change

http://confluence.jetbrains.net/display/Kotlin

Please add kotlin language support.

Removing both of these from the commit and pushing again will immediately update Pivotal Tracker.

fields.description:
When you configure bitbucket to use own domain issue url in commit message is wrong (using # notation in commit comment)

Fore example:

IS:

http://hg.webdh.pl/dawidholewa/sk-oms/issue/4/notatki-dla-zarejestrowanych-u-ytkownik-w

SHOULD BE:

http://hg.webdh.pl/sk-oms/issue/4/notatki-dla-zarejestrowanych-u-ytkownik-w

(without username - dawidholewa)

fields.description:
Should see:

I assume the following is in your ~/.ssh/config:\\
Host *.compute.amazonaws.com\\
user ubuntu\\
StrictHostKeyChecking no\\
IdentityFile ~/olark_project/key_pairs/foo.pem

I see:

I assume the following is in your ~/.ssh/config:\\
Host *.compute.amazonaws.com\\
System Message: WARNING/2 (<string>, line 10); backlink

Inline emphasis start-string without end-string.\\
user ubuntu StrictHostKeyChecking no IdentityFile ~/olark_project/key_pairs/foo.pem
fields.summary: README.rst render problems

fields.description:
Hi,

I just marked one of my repositories as a private one, so no one can see it, or may know it even exists.

But a difference between the way bitbucket handles private repositories, and the non existing ones, confirms the existence of that repository.

If repository does not exist, bitbucket throws a 404, but if it does exist, but is private, bitbucket redirects user to login page.

IMHO denying the existence of a private repository is a better approach than the existing one.

Thanks for your great service,

amir
fields.summary: No "404 - Not Found" for private repositories

fields.description:
Can't find your friends? Why not send an invitation.

https://bitbucket.org/user/project/admin/access
fields.summary: Send invitation is failing

fields.description:
Hi,

I've encountered this problem 3 times now in the last few months, so I am surprised that I haven't been able to find anything regarding this in your documentation.

In essence it seems the remote repo (Bitbucket) decides that it needs to be repacked and on a shared host with limited memory this results in the following messages:

{{{\\
#!shell

remote: Counting objects: 9108, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (7317/7317), done.\\
remote: Total 9108 (delta 2579), reused 7839 (delta 1518)\\
Receiving objects: 100% (9108/9108), 120.75 MiB | 795 KiB/s, done.\\
fatal: Out of memory, malloc failed (tried to allocate 177183921 bytes)\\
fatal: index-pack failed\\
}}}

I've found this on Stackoverflow:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4826639/repack-of-git-repository-fails

And it seems to be spot on describing this problem. The proposed solution here is to change the config in the remote (Bitbucket) but as far as I can see this is not anything I can do??

Any suggestions? Thanks for your time!!
fields.summary: Clone/Pull on shared hosting with limited memory results in: "fatal: Out of memory, malloc failed" message (BB-4465)

fields.description:
Basically I use git and bitbucket not only as a git repository but as as convenient means of deployment, not only deploying my apps on various servers but also deploying examples to presentation machines that I use for lecturing, so some of my production machines have my private key. Which is bad --- because I don;t want to give someone who steals this key address to all my repositories (some of which hold sort of confidential code).

I guess ideal would be to just allow .ssh keys to be limited to particular repositories. For now I circumvent this issue by creating artificial users and sharing  these private repos with them (which is OK since as an educational user I have unlimited repo plan) but this approach is kind of problematic since I have to obtain unique email address for each of these users. And it just doesn't feel right to create multiple accounts.

So any means of resolving this problem would be OK.
fields.summary: Allow to somehow limit access of particular keys to some repositories (BB-4457)

fields.description: I have a user account and a team account and it is impossible to use the same SSH key for both. It is understandable with different user accounts but very annoying with team accounts. Do you intend to allow same ssh keys for user and team accounts?
fields.summary: Same SSH key for different accounts

fields.description:
Hi, the new Basecamp just released a new feature where people can email their projects to create/contribute discussions, todo lists, todos and add files.  This requires certain terminology in the subject line of the email.  If bitbucket notifications or services had a subject line available in the notifications option, we would be able to notify new Basecamp projects like we could in basecamp classic.

I might not be too clear here, but it seems there is a fairly easy opportunity to get bitbucket to send messages to the new basecamp.

Thanks
fields.summary: Suggestion for new email functionality in Basecamp (BB-4444)

fields.description:
I received a pull request on davidmc24/scm-activedirectory-auth-plugin, and then accepted it.  When I got a notification email that the pull request had been accepted, it had incorrect information in the email.  In particular, it claimed that someone else that I've never heard of (mcgarrybowen LABS) accepted the pull request.

Email contents:

Pull request BCLOUD-5 has been accepted by mcgarrybowen LABS.

Changes in sdorra/scm-activedirectory-auth-plugin have been pulled into davidmc24/scm-activedirectory-auth-plugin.

https://bitbucket.org/davidmc24/scm-activedirectory-auth-plugin/pull-request/5/fix-login-for-users-without-mail
fields.summary: Wrong information in pull request accepted notification

fields.description: Our repository says things have been pushed '8 hours from now' because one of our computer's clocks is wrong. Could this just be done by the server, rather than individual users computers?
fields.summary: Computer Time vs Server Time
